meanings.definition: Shyers (noun): plural form of shyer, a person who is timid or easily frightened
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the shyers stayed close together for safety.
meanings.sent2: The group of shyers hesitated to approach the loud noise.
meanings.sent3: The shyers at the haunted house clung to each other in fear.
meanings.sent4: The shyers in the movie theater jumped at every sudden sound.
meanings.sent5: The shyers in the class avoided speaking up during presentations.

meanings.definition: Shyers (verb): third person singular present of shy, to start suddenly aside in alarm or fear
meanings.sent1: The cat shyers away from the vacuum cleaner every time it turns on.
meanings.sent2: She shyers when she hears thunder rumbling in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The dog shyers at the sight of a squirrel darting across the yard.
meanings.sent4: He shyers from any situation that makes him feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The horse shyers at the sight of a plastic bag blowing in the wind.

meanings.definition: Shyers (adjective): comparative form of shy, more reserved or timid than others
meanings.sent1: The shyers kitten preferred to hide under the bed when visitors came over.
meanings.sent2: She felt shyers than her outgoing sister at the party.
meanings.sent3: The shyers student blushed when called upon in class.
meanings.sent4: The shyers puppy cowered behind its owner in new surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The shyers child clung to their parent's leg in the crowded store.
